Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student is likely able to draw two figures that are meant to represent students, but they may not be easily recognizable.
The student may attempt to draw a line meant to represent the string, although it may not connect clearly between the figures or be taut.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to show the string being stretched between two cups, as they may not understand the concept of a string telephone.
The student is unlikely to illustrate one student talking while the other is listening, as they may not grasp communication through the device.
The student will have difficulty representing sound waves or vibrations with relevant features (e.g., missing or unrelated symbols).
Labels indicating the importance of a taut string or the function of the cups are unlikely to be present (student may not know these details).
The student likely cannot explain how the cups function like speakers (student might not understand sound transmission).
Any caption or label explaining the communication technology is likely missing, as the student may not comprehend the task fully.
